biography.placeOfBirth: Zlín, Protectorate of Bohemia and Moravia [now Czech Republic]
biography.bio: Jan Hrabeta was born on May 10, 1940 in Zlín, Protectorate of Bohemia and Moravia. He is an actor and assistant director, known for Horákovi (2006), Lijavec (1997) and Dumb Bobes, or Czech Tarzan (1997).
biography.name: Jan Hrabeta

biography.bio: As a result of being a dedicated Czech language teacher, Mr. Svìrák had little time for his creative writing. However, he soon opted to write articles for magazines, short stories for the youth, and TV screenplays. He also worked in the Czechoslavakian Radio on an entertainment program. In 1966, Mr Svìrák co-founded "The Theater of Jára Cimrman", a theater dedicated to the research of life and death of the newly discovered Czech genius. The theater exist to the present day, having produced twelve plays about this fictious hero that many believe in his existence. Since his first breakthrough into the entertainment business in the sixties Zdenìk Svìrák wrote numerous screenplays, an appeared manz times on both, the silver and the TV screens.
biography.name: Zdenek Sverák

biography.placeOfBirth: Rychnov nad Kneznou, Czechoslovakia [now Czech Republic]
biography.bio: Jaroslav Weigel was born on January 2, 1931 in Rychnov nad Kneznou, Czechoslovakia. He is an actor and costume designer, known for Blaník (1998), An Uncertain Season (1988) and Lijavec (1997).
biography.name: Jaroslav Weigel

biography.bio: Milon Cepelka was born on September 23, 1936 in Pohori, Czechoslovakia. He is an actor and writer, known for Murder in a Parlor Car Compartment (1997), Vysetrování ztráty trídní knihy (1997) and Lijavec (1997).
biography.name: Milon Cepelka

biography.placeOfBirth: Písek, Protectorate of Bohemia and Moravia [now Czech Republic]
biography.bio: Petr Brukner was born on May 19, 1943 in Písek, Protectorate of Bohemia and Moravia. He is an actor, known for Moi qui ai servi le roi d'Angleterre (2006), Les fêtes des perce-neige (1984) and Dinner for Adele (1978).
biography.name: Petr Brukner
